comments:
on windowsXP you can have a folder name like "d:\! temp\eclipse" just fine, though eclipse won't start from there but only give an error

---
!SESSION Wed Aug 30 11:46:08 CEST 2006 -----------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2006-08-30 11:46:09.31
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:186)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:336)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:280)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

This is a known issue and is covered in the README file shipped with Eclipse.

Also see bug 3109 and bug 17281.
